address.addrLine: Miss Fanny Bennett | 11 Seymour Street | Liverpool.

dateline.date: Thursdy Eighth April 1869.Address and date at foot of letter: the “a” omitted from “Thursday”. CD read in Liverpool, 5, 6 and 8, 9 April.

body.p: Mr. Charles Dickens presents his compliments to Miss Fanny Bennett and regrets that he could not have the pleasure of availing himself of her courteous invitation to attend her concert last night.Miss Bennett gave her “annual concert” at the Lord Nelson Street concert hall (formerly the Socialist or Owenite Hall of Science), with the Mayor and his party in attendance. She sang several pieces “with excellent taste”, including Sir Henry Bishop’s Echo song, which was encored (Liverpool Mercury, 8 Apr 1869). But he found himself obliged to remain within doors for rest all the evening.
